Yes, the `pip install --user` command is used to install a package for a single user.

The `--user` flag tells `pip` to install the package in the `~/.local` directory, which is specific to the current user. This means that the package will be available only for the user who ran the installation command, and it will not be included in the system-wide package directory.

By installing a package using `pip install --user`, you can keep your personal packages separate from the system-wide packages, which can help to avoid conflicts and ensure that your packages are not accidentally installed for other users.
